title: Can we write as 'in lieu of 'in place of ' instead of '? - Quora

response.answer_text: Let's understand the meaning of both phrases first. To be in lieu of something is to replace it or substitute for it. Instead of is to use as a substitute or replacement; in the place or instead of someone or something: So both mean the same hence instead of can be written in place of in lieu of.
http://no.in lieu of . means. in the place of. instead of means other than something. give me coffee instead of tea you worked on the Sunday. in lieu of Sunday you get a holiday on monday.
Yes - ‘in lieu of’ translates as ‘instead of’ (or ‘in place of’). So, you could use those three phrases together in any order to give the same message!
WORD ORIGIN FOR LIEU In lieu of:- Lieu is from old French. In Latin meaning “locus” place. in lieu of, in place of; instead of: All these idioms bear the same meaning.
